userData.name: Gabriel Stawny
userData.interests: Listening to music, Traveling, Playing video games and Watching Live Coding

metadata.description: Hi, I'm a programmer with experience in several languages, strong analytical skills, ease of adapting to new challenges, and a focus on contributing to innovative projects. Here you can find more information about my projects and the technologies I use. Maybe we'll run into each other at a street race someday.

topics.title: Area of Expertise
topics.description: Work focused on developing web systems to support agricultural trials and technical evaluation processes.

topics.title: Technologies - Front-end
topics.description: Development and maintenance of interfaces using Svelte, including navigation flows, data visualization screens, and advanced integrations with Highcharts.

topics.title: Technologies - Back-end
topics.description: Implementation of business logic and REST/JSON integrations in PHP and Laravel, with a focus on scalability and well-structured architecture.

topics.title: Database
topics.description: Data modeling and manipulation in MySQL, including efficient SQL query creation, filtering, and pagination.

topics.title: Query Optimization
topics.description: Performance improvements through query optimization and handling of complex data structures, including tree-based models.

topics.title: Report Generation
topics.description: Creation of comprehensive reports in multiple formats (PDF, Excel, Word, and slides), using templates or fully dynamic generation as needed.

topics.title: Extension Projects
description: Led the development of an institutional platform for scientific evaluation.
+100 professors using the platform during the congress.

topics.title: Algorithms Teaching Assistant
description: Provided direct academic support to +50 students.
Focused on computer science fundamentals and analytical problem-solving.
Strengthened academic collaboration with faculty members in the field.

shockwave.shortDescription: Full stack project developed with Spring Boot and Next.js, carried out in partnership with the <police>Paran√° Military Police</police>, focusing on the analysis and evaluation of the real impact of explosives.

topics.title: Design Patterns
topics.description: Application of design patterns such as Singleton, Factory, and Strategy to promote code reuse, decoupling, and maintainability.

topics.title: Formula Engine
topics.description: Development of a metadata-driven formula engine in which calculations are defined in the database rather than hardcoded in the application.

topics.title: Relational Computation Graph
topics.description: Implementation of a relational computation graph that enables chaining formulas with interdependent relationships and compositions.

topics.title: Typed EAV Data Modeling
topics.description: Data modeling based on Typed EAV (Entity-Attribute-Value) to support flexible storage of dynamically typed attributes.

topics.title: Technologies Used
topics.description: Stack composed of Java 21, Spring, PostgreSQL, and Docker on the back end, and Next.js with Zod, React Hook Form, and TanStack Query on the front end.

syncgym.shortDescription: API developed with Spring Boot, following Clean Architecture principles, using as a case study a backend for a gym workout management application.
